intro: Sebastiania pubiflora, commonly known as the velvetleaf sebastiania, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with distinctive floral structures. The plant is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy yellow-orange flowers that are clustered in umbels. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded environments. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny seeds, aiding in its dispersal.
